website_summaries.verdict: Fills your tank with gas quickly though speed is slower when pumping gas uphill.
pros: Minimizes spilled fuel with controlled engineering that pumps about 5 gallons of gas
Portable and great to take with you on trips or use at your home for gas-powered machines
cons: Make sure you follow instructions to a "T" as this is not the most adaptable tank product

customer_reviews.title: Beware the quality of this pump and the integrity of the TeraPump company.
customer_reviews.text: Pump worked well for about 12 uses in a years time. it then developed a leak . Customer service refused any assistance other than if I send it back(at my expense) they will repair it and charge me for the repair. The pump is, supposedly, guaranteed for a Year.
customer_reviews.author: D. Black

customer_reviews.title: The first one I purchased stopped working after I've couple ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I purchased stopped working after I've couple of months it was replaced by the company. The second one stopped working in addition the glue that holds the sensor in the tube came loose and was not working properly. I do not use this product today because it does not work
customer_reviews.author: Rabbitski9

customer_reviews.title: One Stars
customer_reviews.text: The review I gave was premature. I hadn't used it yet. Now that I have tried to use it. I have tried everything It doesn't work. The impeller turns but it will not pump. I feel I got screwed out of 60 bucks. I am still wait for someone at terapumps technical advice. I have left a message and I emailed them. I hope I don't have to hold my breath because I don't look good in blue. I am waiting for a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Pomerleau

customer_reviews.title: I bought this and it worked great for about three months then started acting up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it worked great for about three months then started acting up. Pump only works now when holding down fill button. I contacted Amazon and product company with no results. Very disappointed because I use amazon prime almost daily and just wanted a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased that I found this transfer pump, and its specs looked good. The pump aspects of this product seemed reasonable and very similar to two-battery designs currently on the market. Unfortunately my terapump leaks. Somewhere around the intake (where the dip tube enters the battery housing) there must be a bad seal or something. Really, I should know better because this is my fourth pump in two years. What I really want to find is old Rieke hand pump, but I have not seen any on Amazon. Perhaps, this is a good product, and I just got a bad one, but VirVentures should consider whether or not they want to continuing selling this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was nice the first time
customer_reviews.text: Was nice the first time I used it........by the 3rd time it died completely. I replaced batteries....same thing. This is a real waste of money - IF it worked like the 1st time I used it, ALL the time, it would get a 3 star only as it is VERY slow and very messy when changing.......very poor design. I just threw it in the trash.......wasted money........AND now they are not giving all the accessories (charging extra for them) AND are now charging a lot more for the base unit. Find some other way to pump your gas to your mowers, etc!
customer_reviews.author: R!CK

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no spilling!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure something like this would work well. But a fellow boater -- whose profession is operating a rescue boat -- always has on hand whatever he might need to assist others, including several 5 gal gas containers. He uses a Terapump whenever he has to help someone who is out of fuel. He's had his for over a year, so I decided it was worth trying. I use it to fuel up a small generator that I run on the boat sometimes. I've used it several times now, and it works great. It would be a great product on land, but on a rocking boat, it is even better!
customer_reviews.author: Tobyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Really works great
customer_reviews.text: So if I had to come up with a criticism I have two, but really this is a great little product. I have 2 of these pumps, and on one of them the red battery cover is a little warped And just doesn’t stay. My other criticism is that it doesn’t quite suck up every bit of gas in the gas can even if you roll it around and try and get everything in the same corner. But both of those are kind of petty. This is a great little pump for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Biondi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: So this item is a little expensive...but it's worth every penny. With the way today's gas cans are made, trying to even fill the lawnmower is a hassle, and gas ends up spilling everywhere, which kind of negates the point to the "safety" gas cans. This device makes it all super easy. I typically keep about 20 gallons of gas on hand for the mower, generator, etc., and even to fill up the car in a pinch. Having this pump makes it all super easy, and the auto shutoff makes it even better...just put in the nozzle, turn it on, and it shuts off when the tank is full. Love it! Would definitely buy again, and probably will, as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately product leaks gas at the junction of the pump cap and the generator cap.
customer_reviews.text: This product performed well as far as suctioning, and pumping the gas. Unfortunately, there is a leak at the end, when the nozzle stops due to sensing the recipient container is full (great feature), and that's when it leaks. It seems to be missing a gasket? That's too bad, because as I get older, lifting a 5 gallon can and maneuvering it over the generator probably will grow increasingly more difficult. However, if it is going to spill some anyway, for now I will stick to lifting the 5 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: LBravo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.........
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 34 days since I bought this and I was using it every day . This product is too good to be true. Poor quality. Even the tubing looks to lightweight. I want to cry right now. $64 and it’s not working. Return no longer available. Warranty claim status: they will send me instructions with a code to return it in 7-10 business days.... then what? By the time I get a new one it’s gonna be longer than I have owned the thing. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary York

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Got it and been testing for a while now, I can say it works better than advertised. Put new batteries in, screw on the correct adapter, then power on with the green button and it does the job quickly and easily without any spills. And I should mention, the ability to back flow when you are finished. Simply wait for it to run back and then you can disconnect. Worth the money so far and I am hoping it lasts longer than others have reviewed, I have been using it a while now filling the vehicles that are on my location
customer_reviews.author: Deon P.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy, Super Fast,Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 5 gallon gas can that I use to fill our portable generator that we use when we have power outages. I wanted to make sure my wife is able to fill the gas in the generator should she need it when I am not at home. The gas can was too heavy for her to use when full so I needed a simple solution and the Terapump was perfect. It connected to the can easily with the supplied adapter. I put in the 4 AA batteries and it was ready to go. It is now super easy for anyone to fill the generator with fuel when needed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Max Power

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This pump is exactly what I needed for putting gas into my boat tank. The gas cap on my boat is located on the top of the hull gunnel and required that I hold the full 5 gallon can above the gunnel while the gas slowly drained into the tank. No more! Now I just set the gas can on the front raised decking and run the pump to put the gas into the boats fill cap. Couldn't be easier unless I got someone else to put gas into my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Kent C.

customer_reviews.title: spills
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the pump pictures I imagined fuel would safely travel up the hose and safely be disposed at the other end. What happens instead is where the pump connects to your fuel can it must be tightly screwed on just as a cap onto the can, otherwise the fuel just bursts and spills all around. Not sure what they were thinking when making this, but apparently the only way to use it is if you are able to have a matching gas can with matching thread so that the pump can be screwed on tight.
customer_reviews.author: NikA

customer_reviews.title: Did not Believe Claim
customer_reviews.text: I did not believe that AAA batteries in a transfer pump could do the job. I was WRONG. I use the pump to transfer diesel fuel from 5-gallon cans to both the lawnmower and the tractor. I have transferred over 50 gallons on the first set of batteries. This pump saves me from lifting these heavy cans up over the hood and trying to get the fuel into the funnel without spilling. The funnel also blocks seeing the fuel level and often I overfilled the tanks making a mess. The automatic cut off on this unit really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Judi -170 Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first...but lasted less than a year
customer_reviews.text: had one of the earlier versions and it worked like a champ for a few years. That one finally failed so I purchased a new one, the latest version. It seemed mostly the same at first but after just a few uses over the first few months, it started to fail. It got to the point where I had to hold the button down for it to work at all. Flow rate kept dropping from where it started (and fresh batteries make no difference). It looks like by "3rd Gen" they mean cheaper and cheaper parts to the point of ruining what was a good product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Emaus

customer_reviews.title: Must have wife assist tool!
customer_reviews.text: My wife usually mows the grass for exercise reasons. Way to go baby! But she cannot lift the 5 gallon gas can without spilling the gas all over the mower and garage. So I ordered this unit. So easy to use. Position the spout so it is in the mower gas tank below the fill line, then hit on. Gas pumps quickly and stops at the spout fill line. Once the pumping stops lift the line straight up in the air and the gas runs back into the gas can. Nothing could be easier. Replace the batteries when needed. Nothing is too good for my wife!
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I have difficulty feeling the tank of my mini excavator from diesel cans. I have standard cans from a hardware store. However, the cap does not fit tightly so it often leaks while I'm transporting the cans. Additionally, the weighted end with the pump in it does not fit in the can easily, And the first time I tried to remove the pump out of the can the tip popped off and so the little fan blade is exposed. Now I can't get it out of the can and it doesn't work. This thing is trash
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: I use this pump to fuel a Kubota RTV500. With the gas can setting on the ground press the start button. It takes about two minutes to fuel the vehicle. It is easy to set up and use. No safety devices that make use near impossible. The auto shut off works perfectly. The storage for the hose is well thought out. A simple push and let go of the hose puts the pump in storage mode. I recommend this fueling system and will purchase more when needed. Thomas Christian
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed how quick the order was received. The quality of the pump appears to be durable and very good! Simple to operate, comes.with 3 other gas container adapters giving 4 total. Makes transfers quick and easy without a mess. Has impressive 3 gallon per minute transfer rate. Take note: In further observation of the adapters, they will not fit all gas containers! I have 6 plastic gas containers of varying thread sizes and these adapters only fit the newer more coarse thread containers. Would think that they would have included older thread size to. The pump works great!
customer_reviews.author: KLB

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pump on initial use
customer_reviews.text: Just received this pump earlier today, and tried it out. Too soon to speak of its durability, but, on initial use, it's GREAT. I only wish that I had found this a long time ago. We have three small diesel tractors, and it's difficult to fuel any of them by pouring from the can. With this pump, we can fuel them easily without lifting or danger of overfilling, and it pumps fuel faster than the cans pour it! Will be purchasing a second one for gasoline. Note: no need to purchase the additional can adaptors ... they are simply one more set of the adaptors that come with the pump, and one of them fit my cans perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: Used once quit working
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump once, thought it was great, no more gasoline on my generator rather than in my generator. Put pump away for a year, pulled it out, it didn't work. Figured the batteries were dead, went and got new Duracell batteries, pump still doesn't work. Deeply disappointed, as I would much rather have used this device over trying to lift and accurately pour from the misbegotten abortions of engineering known as the modern gas can. Update: Perhaps the Terrapump knew I was bashing it, because, it started working again. Updated to three stars, though, if the Terrapump continues to have an attitude, the star rating may become a moving target.
customer_reviews.author: Blake W. Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: We've had it all summer, and wish we had it years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Have now used for over two months and I am impressed. We have a ski boat on a lift on a private lake, and the only way to fuel it is by hauling five 5 gallon cans down to it. We still have to do that, but this product allows us to have the can sit upright on the back of the boat while this handy device empties it in under 3 minutes. When we're done, we store it under the seat. We're still on the original batteries too. Wish we had this years ago because makes lake life much easier 🌞
customer_reviews.author: Art DeBruyn

customer_reviews.title: Good for pumping diesel
customer_reviews.text: Very handy for use with my backhoe. I put the diesel can on top of the backhoe hood and pump the diesel into the 40 gallon tank on the backhoe. The position of the cap on the tank is awkward when directly pouring from a 5 gallon plastic can. The new "safety" spouts result in much spillage of diesel. The pump solves the spilling problem. So far I have pumped 15 gallons and have not had to replace my rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: hose cracked
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great when it was working. We have a stand on fertilizer spreader and the fuel tank is inaccessible with a normal fuel can. This pump made filling the tank easy all summer. However, toward the end of summer the hose became brittle and cracked in several places, spewing fuel. To be fair, the fuel can was in a trailer outside most of the summer and I'm sure the constant exposure to sunlight didn't help, but we feel it should have lasted more than one summer.
customer_reviews.author: mark weiss

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I hate funnels, let me say that again, I hate funnels. Also, California has ruined gas cans for the rest of America. So, throw away your crappy CARB approved pour nozzle, and buy this thing. Only be careful not to look away when filling your motorcycle, it fills pretty quick and once you hit the green button to turn it on, you have to hit the red button to stop it. If you're daydreaming, it will get away from you. 4 double A batteries... genius.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gas on Hands!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but when you remove the tube from the gas can your hands get covered in gas ... also the cap over the impeller fell off twice into the gas can and it will not operate without it and then you are left to fish it out of the can ... also one time while unscrewing the machine it turned on and pumped fuel out onto the ground. A lot more messes and fuel on hands than the old fashioned pouring or using a siphon.
customer_reviews.author: drrescu

customer_reviews.title: gas pump
customer_reviews.text: if I could give this zero stars I would it is a piece of junk no matter in what position I placed the can level with the car or above it or below it this thing would not pump more than 2 gallons and then it shut off this is one of the worst amazon purchases I have ever made DO NOT BUY THIS WORTHLESS THING unless you want complete frustration which what I got trying to use it and yes I read the directions and filled them completely I even went over them twice to see if I was doing something wrong it just does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.author: ben klink

customer_reviews.title: Best device ever!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical but the gas transfer now happens with ease. No lifting and struggling to fill the boat. 2 minutes and 5 gal is in. It’s pricey but works just as described. Our boat filler is way at the back of the boat and filling was a 2 person job with spills and frustration along with holding 40lbs for way too long. Problem solved! We referred this product to a friend and they purchased as well. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chick-a-dee

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After Half Dozen Uses
customer_reviews.text: This pump stopped working after 4 months a probably a half dozen uses. Terapump says I have to pay to ship it back to them to fix or replace. And to add insult to injury, the pump is now 31% less that I paid just 4 months ago. I’m not sure it’s worth dumping another $15 to ship it back. Particularly if the new one is no better quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tholen

customer_reviews.title: A PUMP THAT REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I received this TRAF01 pump yesterday and put it on a six gallon gas can to fill my two lawn mowers. It worked to absolute perfection. It filled both mowers with no spills, no waste, and no heavy lifting. I am 80 years old and my wife is 79. Neither one of us needs to be lifting the five and six gallon cans of gasoline to fill the mowers. When we did lift the cans to fill the mowers, there was always waste and spillage. That problem is in the past with the purchase of this pump. I am completely satisfied and very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Easy YES, mess NO
customer_reviews.text: Finally someone made an easy to use gas can nozzle! Every nozzle I had up until now either spilled gas or was difficult to manipulate and pour at the same time. With this device, no more lifting the cumbersome gas can, and dealing with a user-unfriendly spout! With the 3 different sized gas can fittings that came with this product, one fit the gas can I have. Put in batteries, attach the spout and press the ON button. I love this, buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave L

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The pump started leaking after 3 months of use. It is supposed to have a 12 month warranty. I called the manufacturer they said I would need to pay to ship the defective pump back to them and they would email me a questionnaire and an approval for the return shipment. That's been 2 weeks ago. The man I spoke with seemed unconcerned with my problem with a so what attitude.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky R.

customer_reviews.title: It is as it advertised 100% waterproof and it works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most practical and useful devices I have found. I personally live off the grid and I've had three major heart attacks so I can't lift a lot and this thing is awesome and works just as it's advertised in fact it works fantastic. Also as advertised it's 100 percent waterproof and moisture proof. Why this is I live on the coast of Oregon where it rains pretty much all the time and very damp. This device is holding up great inside the dog house with the generator which is outside. I personally recommend this device for anybody who has trouble lifting heavy gas cans.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this transfer pump for my snow blower and lawnmower. My wife does most of the lawn work so I was most interested in relieving her of the difficulty of filling the lawnmower. This transfer pump works exactly as it's supposed to! At this price point I don't expect it to last forever and the construction is not commercial grade. It does what it is supposed to do with a minimum of set up required. Will definitely purchase another when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Kege1

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Really saved the day for putting gas in my boat. I will say it only works with the newer "spill proof" gas cans. I tried it with a much older gas can (vintage 1984) and it leaked. This didn't bother me because I can actually pour gas out of that can unlike the newer cans which just leak gas everywhere. Doesn't seem to chew through batteries all that bad. I've pumped about 40 gallons of gas with it and its still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: W15

customer_reviews.title: What a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Order arrived fast as promised. It is really easy to use. You will need to supply 4 AA batteries. Included are 3 adapters for different types of gas cans. I hooked right up and pumped out my first can. No mess. I like this because it is nearly impossible to dump from the gas can spout into a car. This pump makes an ugly, messy, smelly job easy! I need this because I live in Florada and have to have gas on hand for my generator. This allows me to easily empty the cans into my car so I can get fresh gas for the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Gerryw

customer_reviews.title: Good at first
customer_reviews.text: My previous review for this product was five stars, but now it's down to two. The pump worked very good for two or three times, but then it didn't. I thought the batteries were going out, I changed them, but no better, just weak flow. Also, at first, the pump would work continuously when the 'on' button was pressed, then stop when the 'off' button was pressed, now I have to hold the 'on' button down for it to work at all. Very disappointed, because it looked like a well made item that could save me a little back pain.
customer_reviews.author: SJMars

customer_reviews.title: 5% of the gas ends up on the floor.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea as I have several gas-powered appliances with dark tanks that make it impossible to guage the fuel level while filling. The auto-stop feature would be a godsend. HOWEVER: The pump doesn't fit a standard plastic 5 gallon can. I have 3 'Blitz' cans. They send adapters, but that situation is horrible and leaks all over the place. it seems that the pump has an anti-siphon vent right beside were the pickup hose meets the pump. By design is allows a small ammount of gasoline to leak back into the tank. However it leaks onto the adapters and out of the can.
customer_reviews.author: d t

customer_reviews.title: Really functional item
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a couple to trials, but this items works better than expected. The flow is good, and it does have an auto shutoff (whereas if fluid raises to the nozzle, it stops pumping. This will be an exceptional improvement when I refill my lawn tractor from heavy the gas container. I am also thinking about purchasing another one to use as a water pump, for when I rent an RV and have to refill the water tank (this when without hookups)... Great item so far.
customer_reviews.author: klotzkm

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great. The execution is lacking. The pup worked great for the first 2 times I used it. The third time the pump would not develop any flow and the on button had to be held down the entire time pump was running. Changed the batteries (after only 2 uses) and it worked fine. Went to use it again a week later and the same issue with low flow happened again after only one 5 gallon can pumped out. Adapters worked well to get pump attached to my gas cans. Batteries are too expensive to be used for only 3 minutes and one week between changes.
customer_reviews.author: dboyles81165

customer_reviews.title: No more spilling gas
customer_reviews.text: When ever I'd poured gas from the can to the tank I would get more on the ground than into the tank. The new pour spouts on the gas cans don't seem to work and spill all the time. It got to the point that I would use a funnel, unit the time I couldn't find one. After purchasing this product, I will never spill gas again. This made transferring fuel a snap. Fits on any gas can with all the tops it comes with. I like the auto shut off feature also. Great item. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Romero

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - no more holding up a heavy gas can for what seems like forever.
customer_reviews.text: With the new no vent gas cans, it is a tedious process to fill my boat tank at the dock. It involved heft and holding a 5 gal gas can while slowly pouring fuel. This pump works great. I can set it on the dock and reach the boat fuel fill with the hose and turn on the pump. It only takes minutes to empty the gas can. It will even pump a flow above the level of the gas can, although much slower. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.  I’m was impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Was really surprised by how well it worked and how little fuel spilled in the process. Usually at least two of us, our boat and a bit of the water below the fuel tank could all blow up when we are done transferring 2 5gallon containers on Lake Powell w the slightest wind. This time—with this pump-I did it by myself-and ONLY had to wash my HANDS from putting the pump back in to it’s package for storage. Ridiculously amazing. Hope it continues to do it on our future trips. (If not, I will update it.) Price is worth giving it a try for your circumstances for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for winterizing boats and motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: Made winterizing my boat a breeze. I pull my small tank for my kicker motor out, and drain the gas. Used to be a messy job. With the Tarapump, it was quick and spill free. I keep my 20 gallon full and put fuel stabilizer in it. This works great topping off the tank with a 5 gallon on the ground. No more lifting it up to top off the tank. Also worked great for my motorcycle. Topped off the tank with it, put fuel stabilizer in, installed my battery tender and put it up on a lift for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Avoid disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It’s not stated in the online description, but when you read the enclosed instructions, you will find it will not pump uphill. That means you must lift the gas container up as high as the tank you are filling. That of course defeats the whole purpose of the “pump”. Not sure if you could sent it back if you have tried it, gas odor likely would be a problem. So, just avoid buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bebes papa

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump while getting ready for hurricane Dorian and was totally disappointed with the product performance. If you are using a 5 gallon container, the intake hose is too long and the pump will not work. I had to add another hollow 1 1/4 inch tubing to raise the line but even with that, the fuel flow was mediocre. Not a good product and I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge from New York

customer_reviews.title: Already stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April 2020. Four months later, and it is no longer working. I have contacted the company today'via the e-mail address listed on their website. I'll update the review in accordance with the customer service they provide me. Edit: 8/23/2020 - Still no response from customer service to the e-mail I sent them. I wouldn't buy this product again nor recommend it to anyone. I consider it a waste of $60.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I guerss it works but too big for a Swiss  Jerry can
customer_reviews.text: The intake end is too big for a Swiss Jerry can. How hard could it possibly be to design and make a low-volume gas transfer device that is actually USABLE? I've bough several different items that claim to transfer gasoline. They all have some silly problem, like this one with the end designed to NOT fit in a gas tank, or even a jerry can. The only one that's always reliable is a length of plain tubing that I use as a siphon, sucking on one end to get it started, and letting go fast enough to avoid a mouth full of gasoline, just like I did 70 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Wimer

customer_reviews.title: Solved a big problem of putting gas into our boat tank
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for putting gas into our boat tank, from cans of gas we carry down to the dock. Works perfectly and easily. Have used it to transfer gas from one can to another, too. Getting our money's worth by bringing gas from the gas station rather than going to the marina and getting it. This will also work for putting gas into lawnmowers, generators, etc. Definitely love it!
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyLane

customer_reviews.title: Not a second generation pump.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when you order this as what I received was not the second generation pump. I received a first generation and I know this because I already had one. I should send it back since they are falsely advertising a second generation when it is not, but I had good luck with my first one so I will keep it. Come on Amazon, this is false advertisement, fix your description to reflect the correct pump.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Hanging over the edge of our boat trying to dump gas in was a nightmare. Now I hook the pump to the can hit a button and just wait for it to fill and automatically shut off. The automatic shutoff on the generation 3 works flawlessly. It has turned a hated job into something you look forward to doing. Makes it as easy as pulling up to a gas station.
customer_reviews.author: DPNY88

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Built, cheap
customer_reviews.text: The first one that came stopped working after using it one time. The sensor in the spout was broke and it wouldn’t pump. So I returned it and got a new one. After using the second one a few times the bottom Cover broke off inside the gas can and it again wouldn’t pump the gas through the tube. Rather expensive item to break so quickly both times.
customer_reviews.author: chris brach

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a short time then starts leaking.
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of reviews state, this pump works great for a short time then starts leaking. It seems to be coming from inside the pump itself but I can’t find a way to take it apart and attempt a fix. Is this a great idea...yes! Is this a good product...no. Would I buy it again...no way! Apparently there’s no customer service to back it up so I haven’t bothered trying to contact them for a solution.
customer_reviews.author: JoeP.

customer_reviews.title: Recommendation - Don’t Buy - Cheap construction of input/output hoses.
customer_reviews.text: Recommendation - Don’t Buy - On the very first use, the pump output hose had a pinhole leak in it - right in the middle of the hose. Cheap plastic hoses. Concept is a good one but construction quality of the hoses is just not there. Not sure how to fix the hose leak or if it can be fixed....they want me to clean out the diesel, package it back up in a leak proof container and ship it back to them to look at. I’d have to pay custom freight charges on a product contaminated with diesel, and are not guaranteed to get a new pump.
customer_reviews.author: David Earnest

customer_reviews.title: Just received this. I have only use o be ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this. I have only used it once so far but it worked perfectly. I used it on a 5 gallon gas cab with one of the enclosed cap adapters. No issues at all and it filled out lawn mowers up very fast. No leaks at all. Update::: 06/25/2017 After storing for the winter the pump no longer works correctly. I have to keep pressing the on button to get it to work despite new batteries. It’s a shame, this is an awesome pump
customer_reviews.author: vicki47348

customer_reviews.title: Great small equipment fuel pump!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Compact Fuel Pump! My needs were to drain fuel tanks during the off-season for my motorcycles, mowers, whackers, etc. This is a very quiet pump, that can pump up to 50 Gals. With one set of four AA batteries. My only concern is that the battery compartment is not sealed with an O-Ring type seal. Spilled fuel could enter the battery compartment, that could possibly spark a fire!
customer_reviews.author: RangerRich

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and I put on a correct adaptor for my gas can (it came with 3). I put in the batteries and let it go to work. I was super fast!!!!!! I then called my neighbor over to show him. He liked it so much he ordered one from his phone immediately. What have I done before the pump. I will NEVER be without one of these again. It completely eliminates picking up and trying to pour gas out of a five gallon can. That is now a thing of the past. FANTASTIC product. I will definitely order another one if/when this wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Albert N. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from the get go..
customer_reviews.text: Bought the pump, I was optimistic with all of the reviews, but mine leaks from the first use. Seems to be leaking somewhere up in the unit causing a steady stream of gas to run down my tank. Made a mess in my garage in less than 10 seconds. Had the cap on very tight, not that it should matter since it is using a siphon hose. AVOID. AVOID. AVOID. Wonder if Amazon will take it back?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Y from Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased with this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husbands birthday . He's used it 3 times already. He was so happy at how easy it works and the fact it is faster and easy cleanup after trying to get old gas out of lawnmowers, snowmobiles, snowblowers ect. I'm glad it worked out so well for him. Definitely recommend this product. Great price & works better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Check the label on the end of the box !!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the "3rd" generation Terapump and received it today. Checked the end of the product box and the white label had "2nd" generation on it. Looks like the company might be trying to get rid of "new old stock". I went ahead and tried it and it does work as stated. I just have no idea what the difference would be between the 2nd and 3rd generation. Time will tell soon enough what the 2nd generation issues were to initiate a "3rd" generation.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: No customer service
customer_reviews.text: This pump comes with three caps to fit various cans. None fit my fuel can. Zi called the company & was conected to med alert device sales pitch. After I told them off I got back to the company & I will be damned if they did not tell me to go to the hardware store & find a cap that fit. If you have a FUELWORX can do not buy this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: While I got to use this product twice I filled up the tanks on my Exmark which hold 14 gallons in total in two tanks, that will run me about over a month on each fill up. I went to use it today and the unit will no longer work, put new batteries and still no go. can no longer return it so I guess I spent 60 dollars to transfer 28 gallons of fuel. I would no recommend buying this product do to it poor quality and poor reliability!
customer_reviews.author: toy1

customer_reviews.title: With 5 gallon gas containers for use in a generator for hurricanes and having a bad back, it's great to be able to smoothly ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the pump once. It operates as advertised. With 5 gallon gas containers for use in a generator for hurricanes and having a bad back, it's great to be able to smoothly transfer gas without having to hold up containers and dealing with spillage. When using the pump, it's important to make sure that it is screwed on straight. If so, there is no leakage.
customer_reviews.author: NightTrain

customer_reviews.title: I never knew these existed, so stoked!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to aide refueling my boat while on the water. Having to mess with a rocking boat, and refill using a gas can is frustrating. I received this today and was able to easily attach it to my plastic gas can. Installed easy and with a push of a button, I was moving gas from my can to my boat gas tank. The auto shut-off worked perfectly. Very happy with this item. But only time will tell to it's longevity in the field.
customer_reviews.author: JeepJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this pump, and it works very well. I'm able to fill the gas tank in my lawnmower without lifting the can. Simply put the hose in the tank and press the button to start the pump. The pump automatically shuts off when the tank is full. Since I don't have to lift the gas can, I bought a bigger one that will allows me to refill my mower more times between trips to the gas station.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 1 gallon containers - Big drawback for DEF or Radiator fluid transfer
customer_reviews.text: The suction end is too big to fit in a one gallon jug of DEF from Walmart or a one gallon jug of radiator fluid. There is also no cap to fit these jugs. I knew in purchasing it that may be the case, but I might use it for gas or something else. I would not buy the THERAPUMP portable as the suction end has same measurements. This is a big drawback in these products. For those in need, Harbor Freight has one that does fit into these 1 gallon containers.
customer_reviews.author: Blaezer

customer_reviews.title: it's not realiable.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in pumping 4 5-gallon cans of gas into cars. The failed to run when pressing ON button. Yes I changed the batteries. Yes I spoke to their customer service. Product can have all the good qualities on the planet, but when it fails to run for no apparent reason, it's not realiable.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer, Mostly

customer_reviews.title: and holding the six gallon container for what seemed like forever which was very tiring for a 82 yr ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been refueling my boat, and holding the six gallon container for what seemed like forever which was very tiring for a 82 yr old man. I saw this unit on amazon, and after reading all the reviews I decided to give it a try. I can say that I made the right decision as it only takes about 2-3 minutes to transfer the fuel into the boat. should this unit only last a couple of years I would definitely replace it. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine If Used Properly!
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I had was transferring gas from my generator for storage. I was holding the unit and it was working well, but I guess I tilted it and it lost suction... the auto shut-off didn't work and I had gas all over the garage floor. My bad. I wish they had an adapter cap for generator tanks! Other than that, I attached it to a 5 gal tank and filled my riding mower without incident. Nary a drop was spilt! 👍😎
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these pumps. They are great when the work but the quality seems to vary considerably. I have one pump that has worked for over a year with no problems but I have two others that worked for a month or two then suddenly stopped. I suspect it is a quality control issue with the microprocessor board but not certain. Anyhow it not that expensive of pump but they should be more reliable. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: gunslinger 44-40

customer_reviews.title: Returned due to leaking when transferring gas.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept......I am returning this product due to leaking where pump attaches to fuel can. And as we all know leaking gasoline is not only very bad for environmental reasons it has the potential to cause a dangerous situation for the end user.
customer_reviews.author: L L.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. There is a slight delay between when the sensor touches the gas and the pump quits, so it's best to keep the sensor part down in the tank/tube. Also, there is always some gas left in the tube when finished pumping. Maybe turning the pump upside down on the gas can would allow the extra in the tube to be returned to the can.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit any can I got.
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of mad about this. I can't find a can the unit or its adapter will fit on. I tried it out. (Cross threaded on.) Unit works good. (From ground to a bike's tank. Can is supposed to be at tank height.) I will have to make some kind of adapter for a can. Also, it's not long enough to get to the bottom of a Pit Posse can. Will see about longevity.
customer_reviews.author: R.Wolski

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your Money!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got this, I was dying to try it. It was super easy to set up. I filled my snowblower without a hitch. I immediately used it to fill my generator, and ATV! No lifting gas cans! No guessing or trying to look to see if it’s full! It worked without a problem! Highly recommended!!!! May 31 Update: Don’t buy it! I left an initial positive review in order to get a promised free item. (Yes I got a free manual siphon). But the initial battery pump broke after less than 6 uses in 3 months. Great concept but cheap material. Don’t waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: My Pontoon has a filler on the odd side of the boat when at my dock (can't put it on the other side of the dock - too shallow). So it's a pain to add gas on the water side. Usually end up spilling some in the water as well as hard to hand a large gas can upside down. This makes it simple. Set the can on the ground (when out of water) or on the ledge above the filler hole. Then insert the hose and let her rip. Will empty 5 gal in short order (a couple minutes). An inexpensive answer to an irritating issue.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R. Moore Sr.

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL addition to back saving devices!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 70 years old, I can lift a 6 gallon gas can that's full but recently have had some issues holding it up when filling any one of my 4 gas powered machines. This is a PERFECT SOLUTION to my particular issue of holding the gas can up, sometimes 3' in the air trying to fill my lawn tractor! 4 AA batteries and I'll NEVER spill another drop! Tired and tested and yes, it does shut off when the tank you're filling is full! I love this product and it's so worth the $$$ !!!
customer_reviews.author: Fred H.

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking during second use.
customer_reviews.text: When I used this pump the first time it worked great. I was impressed no mess and easily transferred two 5 gallon cans of gas to my vehicle. The next time I used it the first 5 gallon can worked fine, when I started transferring the second can the pump started leaking where the discharge hose comes out of the control head. By the time I got done with the second can I had about a pint of gas all over the can, the ground and me. I have had the pump for not quite 6 weeks, the return period had run out. VERY DISAPPOINTED - WASTED MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY POWERED Fuel Transfer Pump.The ONLY way to fill your Gas-Powered Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Recently received my 2nd Gen TERAPUMP TRFA01. Used it to transfer gas from my gas container to my snow blower fuel tank. Worked better than expected! Wished I had looked into this idea sooner. This TERAPUMP will also make filling my Generator fuel tank so much easier because it is located on the very top of the generator. Would highly recommend this particular TRFA01 to everyone owning any Gas-Powered Equipment Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this purchase. I bought it to refill the generator tank in the event we had an extended outage. I use it for that, the lawn equipment, even the boat. The auto shutoff feature works well. Only suggestion is to be careful and don’t bump the on button unless you are ready for fuel to come out the hose. It doesn’t take much pressure to turn it on. A good purchase in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hartline

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised. Makes filling a gas tank much less frustrating. Plenty of suction to pull gas from the tank but not too much that it splashes. The auto off feature works great and gives you less worry of it over filling the tank. The days of splashing gas all over is a thing of the past. It is also very quiet so that is another big perk. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Phil Haugh

customer_reviews.title: Nearly effortless transfer
customer_reviews.text: I use fuel points from our local grocery store, and often am able to redeem for cheap gasoline, at nearly no cost, but only up to 20 gallons. Car only takes 12 gallon. So 2 five gallon gas cans enables me to take advantage of the full 20 gallon purchase. This pump attaches to the five gallon can and makes the transfer of that 5 gallons effortless. With this pump and the 2 five gallon cans, I get nearly another tankful almost free, Flows fast, flows easily, and is easy to store. No clean-up needed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good product
customer_reviews.text: Upfated review. Initially it worked. Now at under 3 months with very little use it has quit working. Replaced the batteries thinking thstcwas the problem. It is not ! Unit just fails to pump. Works. Need to mount to the gas can to keep it from leaking. I tried without mounting and it leaked. My bad. When mounted it works fine and fast
customer_reviews.author: KenL

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to standard gas cans
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to standard gravity dispensing cans. The pump arrived well packaged and I was up and running within a couple minutes. The pump works great and the auto shut off works well. Unfortunately my pump stopped working just a couple weeks after its first use. I contacted customer service and it was promptly replaced. Hope the replacment lasts. I want to love this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ten Berge

customer_reviews.title: Works great... will it hold up?
customer_reviews.text: I got this item in order to add gas to a generator which I mounted in my camper on a tray. The problem is that the door is about 5 inches over the gas cap. This product worked great to put gas in it. My only hesitation was all of the reviews about the poor longevity. I believe this product has been updated, and only time will tell. I was pleasantly surprised how fast this pump filled up my 2.5 gallon tank in my generator.
customer_reviews.author: Gimpy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Worked Once then Died
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to fill my snow blower in the winter and my power washer in the summer. I used it once to fill my snow blower after a late winter storm in April. It worked great. I got it out yesterday to put gas in my power washer and it was dead. I changed the batteries with new ones (just in case) and still nothing. I fooled with it for 15 minutes before just giving up. Do not buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wally Dut

customer_reviews.title: I returned the product.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as hoped, may have been defective. It was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Harper

customer_reviews.title: Pumps flawless. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Pumps gas fast enough, but leaks a little when your don. The gas in the line can't seep back into can, since it's past the pump, so when you take the spout and store in the pump head hole per the instructions, it leaks. The auto off works great! Bought this for my parents since they're in their 80s and can't lift a 5 gal can of gas. Yes, they still insist on cutting their own grass. LoL
customer_reviews.author: Sig D.

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Have To Lift Heavy Gas Cans
customer_reviews.text: These have strong pumps, and transfer gas from the can to the tank or vice versa, and they pump quickly. They're very handy so you don't have to lift heavy gas cans. They come with some gas top adapters, but need some more because they don't fit all cans; even so, it will pump gas as long as the pump is submerged. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying all small engine people.
customer_reviews.text: Good pump but it has a detent circuit so you push the on button you must push the off to stop the pump. Filling a small tank has over flow every time. It needs capability to have it an instantaneous on switch so if you remove your finger the pump stops. Not sure how this got by OSHA. If something caught fire it would keep pumping fuel onto the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel D. Mckinley Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this to empty my 5 gallon fuel tanks into my trike. I set the gas tank on top of a trash can to set it at least equal to the fuel tank if not higher. It empties the contents of a 5 gallon tank quickly and easily! I have used it about 10 times now, and it's working great. I will update if it fails me, but so far, I don't see why it would.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a very short time, maybe 10- 5 gallon cans in a 3 month time period and the pump died an ugly death of silence. Disappointed for the price I paid, was very happy with it before today.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Eck

customer_reviews.title: Great theory, Not so good operation...
customer_reviews.text: Let me say that these things are TERRIFIC.........when they work. I have purchased three through Amazon, and they aint cheap. 1 is currently leaking near the fill spout, and the others auto shut off feature no longer works. The 3rd is still in the box. I have contacted seller to see what they will do about this. Will update with how that pans out.
customer_reviews.author: Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Works really, really great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pump! I bought two manual ones and both were returned. This one works like a charm. I use it to transfer gas from a container back my car after 4-5 months. This way I always have fresh gas for the generator. It transferred 5 gallons of gas in a little over three minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Greek Geek

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: After pouring from heavy 5-gal fuel containers of gasoline too many times, I decided to give this a try. It works great, with minimal fuel leaks around the pump base. I lose a lot less fuel using this pump, than when I do it manually, and it's so quiet that I can barely hear it running. Time will tell how durable it is, but It's off to a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndhurst Bodden

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. It makes loading gas from a 5 gallon plastic tank much easier, especially versus fighting against the "safety" nozzles. Setup was quick and easy. I appreciate that the 3 fitting adapters are included for versatility. Pump speed was reasonable. This will make cycling gas inventory much easier. Having a generator at my house means needing to have gas on hand, but gas can't be stored for more than a month or so, even with a fuel stabilizer added. I hope this tool lets me keep that supply fresh by cycling the slightly aged gas through my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: TisDone

customer_reviews.title: The product worked the concept is great. Just I probably got a faulty one
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the pump one time. it sucks the fuel up into the pump quite quickly and sends it straight into my boat's gas tank. However it leaks a pretty large amount from the suction hose where it attaches to the pump. Most of the gas returns into the container from which you are pumping. Since the pump did not attached securely some of the gas also ran down the side of the gas can
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Neal Smith

customer_reviews.title: Got taken on this one AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: This is as piece of junk, and as soon as I tried to fit into my 5 gallon gas container, it broke because it wont fit into the hole!!!! Don't let them get you on this one, it leaked all over the place. Worthless... This seller should be put out of business with these ratings. I should have read them before buying and losing $60 bucks. JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Randall Messina

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY works like it claims,
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, the adaptors that come with it fit all but one of my gas cans (oldest one, 25 years plus). All but one of them used the same adapt. Very pleased with it, and it will suck all the gas out if you tilt away from the spout, the weight of the end suction piece falls to the back of the can and sucks it all out.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

product_meta.title: TERAPUMP 3rd Gen - No More Gas Can Lifting/Fuel Transfer Pump Fitting numerous Gas Cans (Advanced Auto-Stop Function and Flexible In and Out Take Hose)
feature_bullets: Improvements and Updates: Longer hose (25 to 35 inches) / Up to 20% Powerful Motor / Fuel More Resistant Plastics
Size: 14 x 6 x 3.5 Weight: 1.2LB / Transfer to several outlets like gas can / vehicle/ lawn mower so on! / Wet-Resistant Cover for Accidental Spills
2.4 Gallons per min / Requires 4 AA batteries (NOT included) / Flexible Intake hose / No-spill Auto-Stop Nozzle
Fits Most North American Fuel Plastic Cans with 3 different adapters size (included) / Does Not Include Gas Can & Does Not fit FMD Gas Cans
✅ CSA Certified under UL Standards. This product was tested by CSA per an agreement with UL, and is certified for use in both Canada and the US according to applicable Canadian and US standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,640 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
